body: @toddychen I'm testing this now
@toddychen testing this now
Please add license headers, and make sure tests pass.

This doesn't work for me. Given a graph as shown here : In the tree view, If I mark success at the last task in the dag run and select `upstream` & `downstream`, it will set that task as success and ignore all upstream tasks as shown below. If I then repeat that process by move upstream one task at a time for that dag run, marking each task success with `upstream` & `downstream`, then it will again only mark that single tasks success as shown in these 2 screen shots. However, if mark post_op and its downstream as success as shown here as success: I get the following error. This suggests that downstream success marking is not working for this PR. Using an existing test dag :
If this PR dependent on #2074 ? If so, consider submitting them together. I can only test one at a time.

@r39132 Hi, thanks for testing. I have mentioned the detail in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-870. There are two parts of the fix. This PR right now only solves No.1. So it can find the task. What you have right now is the "KeyError", that's No.2 due to the un-sync'ed behavior and implementation of "Recursive" option. So far, just always choose the option "Recursive" along with either "Upstream" or "Downstream". It will work okay.

This is not working for me either. In this example, I've picked `put_op`, which has both upstream and downsteam tasks in the `none` state. If I mark downstream tasks as success, I get If I mark upstream tasks as success, I get

@r39132 The other PR just fix the bug that the code always does a "Downstream" for either "Upstream" or "Downstream" option clicked. (That is really bad.) With that PR, down is down, up is up. So here, with simply this PR, the following usage should work well:
1) select a single task, mark it success without any additional option selected.
2) select a task, mark it success with both "Downstream" and "Recursive" options selected. This will mark all downstream tasks.
3) If you also merge the other PR, then the same usage except changing "Downstream" to "Upstream" should work properly.

After all, this is just a temp fix, Bolke knows this issue and is planning a better fix and improvement in testing in v1.8.1.
I see. Thx. We may just wait for a holistic fix at this point. I'll keep these PRs for reference however.
landscape errors are unrelated

Sorry to resurrect an old PR, but are there any further developments here? I am receiving the following exception when trying to use SFTPHook: paramiko.ssh_exception.SSHException: Error reading SSH protocol banner

The package versions I have tested with:
pysftp: 0.2.8 (downgraded from 0.2.9 because of the issue outlined here: https://github.com/Yenthe666/auto_backup/issues/47 )
paramiko: 2.1.1 and 1.15.1

Edit: Alright I feel really stupid. The issue was that I had forgotten to change the port from 21 (FTP) to SFTP (22) in the Airflow web console. Everything works now. Thanks biellls!

It seems like we guard on `ti is not None` a lot, would it make more sense to just case the whole thing or return

I did this for full backwards compatibility (e.g. if you clear a task in the UI then it won't exist in the DB but could still exist locally if you e.g. have one worker), but I agree it's probably more trouble than it's worth and the DB should be the source of truth. I'll skip tasks that don't exist.
There were a few others in the C section that were out of order, which I fixed as well.
